link:labelLink.link:label: Cost basis of real estate investments for federal income tax purposes for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Amount of net capital in excess of minimum required net capital, calculated under Alternative Standard.
Minimum amount of net capital of broker-dealer subsidiary, calculated under Alternative Standard.

Description of reason mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate was renewed or extended at amount in excess of unpaid amount on previous mortgage.

Description of write-down or reserve of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, explanation of basis of write-down or reserve.

Description of change in investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate from transactions with affiliate and other related party.
Tabular disclosure of net capital requirement for broker-dealer under Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regulation.
Cost per unit of oil and gas production.
Controlled entity included in financial statements of registrant with liability for property-casualty insurance claim.
Amount of decrease in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of sales of minerals in place.
Title and position of individual or group within organization.
Description of guarantees issued by the registrant unless separately disclosed in the consolidated statements.
Description of registrant's mandatory dividend or redemption provisions of redeemable stocks if not separately disclosed in the consolidated statements.
Disclosure of minimum financial requirement per Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) for futures commission merchant (FCM).
Description of significant provisions of long-term obligations of the registrant if not separately disclosed in the consolidated statements.
Number of development wells incapable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantity to justify installation of permanent equipment for production.
Number of development wells capable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantity to justify installation of permanent equipment for production.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about oil and gas development wells drilled.

If a significant portion of the economic interest in the consolidated standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows reported is attributable to a consolidated subsidiary(ies) in which there is a significant noncontrolling interest, that fact and the approximate portion is disclosed here.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Disclosure of information about standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow for interest in proved oil and gas reserves and oil and gas subject to long-term supply, purchase, and similar agreement or contract with government and authority, in oil- and gas-producing activities.
Amount of draft payable by broker-dealer.
Single external customer or group of external customers.
Name of investment including named security. Excludes entity that is consolidated.

Cumulative increase (decrease) for adjustment to previously issued financial statements. Includes, but is not limited to, adjustment for retrospective application of amendment to accounting standards, other change in accounting principle, correction of error, and other revision.
Amount of net capital in excess of minimum required net capital, calculated under Aggregate Indebtedness Standard.
Amount of net capital of futures commission merchant (FCM) in excess of required net capital per Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC) requirement.
Number of exploratory wells incapable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantity to justify installation of permanent equipment for production.
Number of exploratory wells capable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantity to justify installation of permanent equipment for production.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about oil and gas exploratory wells drilled.
Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of extensions, discoveries and improved recovery of proved oil and gas reserves.
Twelve regional cooperative banks that U.S. lending institutions use to finance housing and economic development in their communities.
Information by branch of Federal Home Loan Bank.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about developed and undeveloped oil and gas acreage.
Amount of increase in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of purchases of minerals in place.
Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of change in estimated future development costs.

Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of change in the estimated future income tax on future pretax net cash flows related to the entity's proved oil and gas reserves.

Disclosure of noncash transactions for additions to real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate. Excludes acquisitions through foreclosures.
Loan category for investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Amount of net capital of broker-dealer.
Amount of net capital calculated under Alternative Standard in excess of 5 percent of debit items.

Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of change in sales and transfer prices and in production (lifting) costs related to future production.
Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow relating to proved oil and gas reserves.
Average sale price per unit of oil or gas produced.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Disclosure of information about obligation to provide fixed and determinable quantity of oil and gas under existing contract or agreement. Includes, but is not limited to, principal source and quantity of oil and gas expected to be received and quantity of oil and gas subject to delivery commitment.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about quantity of proved developed and undeveloped reserves for oil and gas-producing activities.
Disclosure of information about oil and gas sale prices and production costs.

Amount payable to other broker-dealer and clearing organization, including, but not limited to, security failed-to-receive, deposit received for security loaned, open transaction, and floor-brokerage payable.
Amount payable to customer by broker-dealer.

Amount of decrease in investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, from collection of principal.
Number of gas-producing wells and gas wells capable of production with working interest ownership.
Number of gas-producing wells and gas wells capable of production representing summation of fractional ownership working interest to whole.
Number of oil-producing wells and oil wells capable of production with working interest ownership.
Number of oil-producing wells and oil wells capable of production representing summation of fractional ownership working interest to whole.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about productive oil and gas wells. Includes oil- and gas-producing well and oil and gas well mechanically capable of production.
Equity method investee of registrant not separately filing financial schedule with Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), with liability for property-casualty insurance claim.
The entire disclosure of real estate investments and associated accumulated depreciation for entities with a significant portion of their business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Amount of lien or mortgage outstanding on real estate investment properties for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Name of the property, for example, but not limited to, ABC Shopping Center.
Information by name of property.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about real estate investments and accompanying accumulated depreciation for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Disclosure of information about reinsurance. Includes, but is not limited to, type of insurance, amount of premium, premium ceded to another company, premium assumed from another company, net amount of premium revenue, and percentage of premium assumed to net premium revenue.
Locations where products are offered for sale to consumers.
Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of revisions of estimated quantity of oil and gas in proved reserves.
Amount of (increase) decrease in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of sales and transfers of oil and gas produced.
Tabular disclosure of oil and gas development wells drilled.
Tabular disclosure of oil and gas exploratory wells drilled.
Tabular disclosure of developed and undeveloped oil and gas acreage.

Amount of contractual principal due at origination of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Interest rate of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Description of contractual payment terms of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, whether mortgage loan is payable at level or varying amount to maturity, balloon payment requirement at maturity, and prepayment penalty.

Amount of principal due on delinquent mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Information by loan category for investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

The entire disclosure for investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, information for each mortgage loan receivable equaling or exceeding 3 percent of carrying amount of mortgage.

Tabular disclosure of obligation to provide fixed and determinable quantity of oil and gas under existing contract or agreement. Includes, but is not limited to, principal source and quantity of oil and gas expected to be received and quantity of oil and gas subject to delivery commitment.
Tabular disclosure of oil and gas sale price and production cost, including, but not limited to, average sale price and production cost per unit.
A roll forward is a reconciliation of a concept from the beginning of a period to the end of a period.
Tabular disclosure of oil- and gas-producing wells and oil and gas wells capable of production.

Tabular disclosure of the net quantities of an enterprise's interests in proved developed and undeveloped reserves of (a) crude oil (including condensate and natural gas liquids), (b) natural gas (including coal bed methane), (c) synthetic oil, (d) synthetic gas, and (e) other nonrenewable natural resources that are intended to be upgraded during the period as of the beginning of the period, changes in quantities during the period, and as of the end of the period.

Tabular disclosure of the future net cash flows relating to proved oil and gas reserves and oil and gas subject to purchase under long-term agreements in which the enterprise participates in the operation of the properties on which the oil and gas is located or otherwise serves as the producer. This information is presented in aggregate and for each geographic area for which reserve quantities are disclosed.
Affiliation to property-casualty insurance underwriter.
Information by affiliation to property-casualty insurance underwriter.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about registrant, its subsidiary, and 50-percent-or-less-owned equity basis investee, with liability for property-casualty insurance claim that is supplementary.
The entire disclosure for valuation and qualifying accounts and reserves.
Amount of short-term bank loan secured by broker-dealer customer's security.
The entire disclosure of supplemental information for registrant, its subsidiary and 50-percent-or-less-owned equity basis investee, with liability for property-casualty insurance claim.

The entire disclosure for the supplemental schedule of reinsurance information. Reinsurance schedule includes, but is not limited to, the type of insurance, gross amount of premiums, premiums ceded to other entities, premiums assumed from other entities, net amount of premium revenue, and the percentage of the premiums assumed to net premium revenue.

The entire disclosure for supplementary insurance information by segment. Includes, but is not limited to, deferred policy acquisition cost; future policy benefit, loss, claim and loss expenses; unearned premium; other policy claim and benefit payable; premium revenue; net investment income; benefit, claim, loss and settlement expenses; amortization of deferred policy acquisition cost; other operating expense; and premium written.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Disclosure of information about supplementary insurance information by segment. Includes, but is not limited to, deferred policy acquisition cost; future policy benefit, loss, claim and loss expenses; unearned premium; other policy claim and benefit payable; premium revenue; net investment income; benefit, claim, loss and settlement expenses; amortization of deferred policy acquisition cost; other operating expense; and premium written.
Minimum amount of net capital of broker-dealer parent, calculated under Alternative Standard.

Noncontrolled subsidiary, not included in financial statements of registrant and not separately filing financial schedule with Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), with liability for property-casualty insurance claim.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about valuation allowance and qualifying account and reserve.
Description of reserve or write-down taken on real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Disclosure of information about write-downs or reserves on real estate investments for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate.
Eliminating entries used in consolidating a parent entity and its subsidiaries.

Entity in which controlling financial interest is held. Includes, but is not limited to, variable interest entity (VIE) consolidated by primary beneficiary. Excludes entity in which broker-dealer holds controlling financial interest but control is likely to be temporary.
An affiliate is a party that, directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with the entity.
Person or persons designated as part of management.
Leader of board of directors.
Person serving on board of directors.
Person with designation of executive officer.
Person with designation of chief executive officer.
Person with designation of chief financial officer.
Person with designation of chief operating officer.
Person with designation of controller.
Person with designation of executive vice president.
Person with designation of vice president.
Person with designation of president.
Person with designation of officer.
A general or limited ownership interest in a partnership or unincorporated joint venture.

Unrefined, naturally occurring petroleum product composed of hydrocarbon deposits and other organic material, and liquid or liquefied hydrocarbon produced in manufacture, purification, and stabilization of natural gas (NGL). Excludes natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, and other nonrenewable natural resources.
Flammable gas occurring naturally underground and liquid or liquefied hydrocarbon produced in manufacture, purification, and stabilization of natural gas (NGL).
Scenario reported, distinguishing information from actual fact. Includes, but is not limited to, pro forma and forecast. Excludes actual facts.
Information reported for future period. Excludes information expected to be reported in future period for effect on historical fact.
Information by scenario reported, distinguishing information from actual fact. Includes, but is not limited to, pro forma and forecast. Excludes actual facts.
A roll forward is a reconciliation of a concept from the beginning of a period to the end of a period.
Description of material contingencies of the registrant unless separately disclosed in the consolidated statements.

Amount of principal due on delinquent mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, acquired from controlled and other affiliates.
The entire disclosure of information about investment held by insurance company, excluding investment in related party.
Disclosure of information about investment held by insurance company, excluding investment in related party.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Description of reason carrying amount was different than cost or fair value for investment held by insurance company, excluding investment in related party.
Information by type of real estate property.
Land and any structures permanently fixed to it.

Indicates requirement of level payment of principal and interest to maturity of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Indicates requirement of varying payment of principal and interest to maturity of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Disclosure of information about write-down or reserve of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Information by mortgage loan written down or reserved for, within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Mortgage loan written down or reserved for, within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Description of basis for write-down or reserve of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Information by name of investment including named security. Excludes entity that is consolidated.

Registrant with controlling financial interest in one or more subsidiaries. Controlling interest in subsidiary includes, but is not limited to, primary beneficiary of variable interest entity (VIE). Controlling interest in subsidiary excludes broker-dealer with controlling financial interest in subsidiary but control is likely to be temporary.
Information by types of proved developed and undeveloped petroleum reserves.

The type of petroleum reserve being disclosed: oil, natural gas, natural gas liquids, synthetic oil, synthetic gas, or other nonrenewable natural resource that is intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas with separate disclosures for consolidated entities and equity method investments.
Natural gas composed primarily of methane gas, excluding liquid or condensate natural gas.

Liquid or liquefied hydrocarbon produced in manufacture, purification, and stabilization of natural gas (NGL). Excludes crude oil, natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, and other nonrenewable natural resources.
Additional information necessary to prevent the disclosure of the standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows and changes therein from being misleading.
Crude oil, which may also include condensate and natural gas liquids.

Represents amount as previously reported before adjustment for retrospective application of amendment to accounting standards, other change in accounting principle, correction of error, and other revision.

Disclosure of information about oil and gas present activities. Includes, but is not limited to, number of wells in process of drilling, waterfloods in process of installation, and pressure maintenance operation.

Tabular disclosure of oil and gas present activities. Includes, but is not limited to, number of wells in process of drilling, waterfloods in process of installation, and pressure maintenance operation.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Number of oil and gas supplies dedicated or contracted to satisfy delivery commitment under existing contract or agreement.
Information by type of loan for investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Type of loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Tabular disclosure of minimum financial requirement per Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) for futures commission merchant (FCM).
Amount of adjusted net capital of futures commission merchant (FCM) per Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC) requirement.
Geographical area.
Information by geographical components.
Disclosure of information about condensed financial statements, including, but not limited to, the balance sheet, income statement, and statement of cash flows.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Net quantities of an enterprise's interests in proved developed reserves of either crude oil (including condensate and natural gas liquids), natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, or other nonrenewable natural resource that is intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas as of the beginning and the end of the year. "Net" quantities of reserves include those relating to the enterprise's operating and nonoperating interests in properties. Quantities of reserves relating to royalty interests owned are included in "net" quantities if the necessary information is available to the enterprise. "Net" quantities does not include reserves relating to interests of others in properties owned by the enterprise. The unit of measure for reserve quantities is defined as "barrels" for oil and synthetic oil reserves or "cubic feet" or "cubic meters" for natural gas and synthetic gas reserves.

Entity owned or controlled guaranteeing issuance of security by another subsidiary or parent. Excludes entity in which broker-dealer holds controlling financial interest but control is likely to be temporary.

Entity owned or controlled not guaranteeing issuance of security by another subsidiary or parent. Excludes entity in which broker-dealer holds controlling financial interest but control is likely to be temporary.

Group of similar original loan amounts for investment in real estate mortgage loan by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Information by original amount of mortgage loan for investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.

Investment in real estate mortgage loan by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, with original loan amount less than $250,000.

Mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, with original loan amount greater than $249,999 but less than $500,000.

Mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, with original loan amount greater than $499,999 but less than $750,000.

Mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, with original loan amount greater than $749,999 but less than $1,000,000.

Investment in real estate mortgage loan by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, with original loan amount of $1,000,000 or more.
Number of mortgage loans within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Information by name or description of a single external customer or a group of external customers.
Credit-ratings as used by Moody's. Contact Moody's for a complete list of ratings and their definitions.
Number of oil and gas wells with process of drilling being temporarily suspended.
Number of oil and gas wells in process of being drilled.

Number of productive wells and wells mechanically capable of production with multiple completions, with sum of fractional working interest owned in gross well expressed as whole number and fraction of whole number.
Number of productive wells and wells mechanically capable of production with multiple completions, with ownership of working interest.
Credit-ratings as used by Standard & Poor's. Contact Standard & Poor's for a complete list of ratings and their definitions.
AAA credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Standard & Poor's.
AAA credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Fitch.
Credit-ratings as used by Fitch. Contact Fitch for a complete list of ratings and their definitions.
AA+ credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Standard & Poor's.
AA credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Standard & Poor's.

CCC credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Fitch.

CC credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Fitch.
C credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Fitch.

Caa2 credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Moody's.
Caa3 credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Moody's.
Ca credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Moody's.
C credit rating as defined by the external credit rating agency, Moody's.
Lubricant consisting of chemical compounds that are synthetically made.
Liquid fuel obtained from other solids, for example, but not limited to, coal, natural gas or oil shale.
Reserves of other nonrenewable natural resources that are intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas.
Amount of increase (decrease) in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of changes from other sources.
Amount of discounted future accumulated cash inflow relating to proved oil and gas reserves.

Description of significant changes to reserve quantities during the period including, but not limited to, changes in the following: revisions of previous estimates, revisions of estimates from application of improved recovery techniques, purchases of minerals in place, extensions and discoveries made, production, and sales of minerals in place.
Number of shares authorized to be purchased under share repurchase plan. Includes, but is not limited to, repurchase of stock and unit of ownership.

Net quantities of an enterprise's interests in proved undeveloped reserves of either crude oil (including condensate and natural gas liquids), natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, or other renewable natural resource that is intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas as of the beginning and the end of the year. "Net" quantities of reserves include those relating to the enterprise's operating and nonoperating interests in properties. Quantities of reserves relating to royalty interests owned are included in "net" quantities if the necessary information is available to the enterprise. "Net" quantities does not include reserves relating to interests of others in properties owned by the enterprise. The unit of measure for reserve quantities is defined as "barrels" for oil and synthetic oil reserves or "cubic feet" or "cubic meters" for natural gas and synthetic gas reserves.
Information by statistical measurement. Includes, but is not limited to, minimum, maximum, weighted average, arithmetic average, and median.
Statistical measurement. Includes, but is not limited to, minimum, maximum, weighted average, arithmetic average, and median.
Upper limit of the provided range.
Lower limit of the provided range.

Maturity date of mortgage loan within investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Information by type of aircraft.
Vehicle designed for flight.
Material used for production of energy in form of heat or power. Includes, but is not limited to, coal, gas, and oil.
Unrefined, unprocessed oil, which may be used in a variety of applications, and from which, petroleum-based products are produced.
Fuel oil used to produce heat in an office, plant, or any other location where temperature is controlled or managed.
Tabular disclosure of condensed financial statements, including, but not limited to, the balance sheet, income statement, and statement of cash flows.
The entire disclosure for condensed financial statements.

Entity in which controlling financial interest is held guaranteeing issuance of security by another subsidiary or parent. Includes, but is not limited to, variable interest entity (VIE) consolidated by primary beneficiary. Excludes entity in which broker-dealer holds controlling financial interest but control is likely to be temporary.
Judicial proceeding, alternative dispute resolution or claim. For example, but not limited to, name of case, category of litigation, or other differentiating information.

Information reported based on historical fact adjusted for potential activity. Includes, but is not limited to, information expected to be reported in future period for effect on historical fact. Excludes forecast information.
Information by share repurchase program.
Name of share repurchase program.
Building containing a number of residential apartments.
Consolidated entity excluding consolidated variable interest entity (VIE) for which reporting entity is primary beneficiary.
Facility designed for the storage of goods or equipment.
Building designed to house industrial operations and provide the necessary conditions for the operation of industrial equipment.
Building designed primarily for the conduct of business, for example, but not limited to, administration, clerical services, and consultation.
Commercial establishment providing lodging, meal, meeting space and other related service.
Property classified as other.

Tabular disclosure of the aggregate change in the standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows relating to proved oil and gas reserves and oil and gas subject to purchases under long-term agreements in which the enterprise participates in the operation of the properties on which oil and gas is located or otherwise serves as the producer.
Tabular disclosure of condensed balance sheet, including, but not limited to, balance sheets of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
Tabular disclosure of condensed income statement, including, but not limited to, income statements of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
Tabular disclosure of condensed cash flow statement, including, but not limited to, cash flow statements of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
Information by name of counterparty. A counterparty is the other party that participates in a financial transaction. Examples include, but not limited to, the name of the financial institution.

Period remaining on lease and concession for undeveloped acreage in oil- and gas-producing activities, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days.
Date real estate investment property was acquired for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate, in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Date real estate investment property was constructed for entities with a substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

B-757-200 aircraft type.
B-777-200 aircraft type.
A-320-200 aircraft type.
A-330-200 aircraft type.
Minimum amount of net capital of broker-dealer and its subsidiary, calculated under Alternative Standard.
Area assigned to productive oil and gas wells with working interest ownership.
Area assigned to productive oil and gas wells representing summation of fractional ownership working interest to whole.

Leased area with working interest ownership on which oil and gas wells have not been drilled or completed that would permit production of economic quantities of oil and gas. Excludes area of undrilled acreage held by production under terms of lease.

Leased area representing summation of fractional ownership working interest to whole on which oil and gas wells have not been drilled or completed that would permit production of economic quantities of oil and gas. Excludes area of undrilled acreage held by production under terms of lease.
Tabular disclosure of contractual obligation by timing of payment due. Includes, but is not limited to, long-term debt obligation, lease obligation, and purchase obligation.

Quantity of oil or gas received under long-term supply, purchase, and similar agreements or contracts with government and authority, if entity either participates in operation of property in which oil or gas is located or serves as producer of reserve.
Quantity of oil and gas subject to delivery commitment.
Quantity expected to be received from oil and gas producing properties.

Additions to proved reserves that result from (1) extension of the proved acreage of previously discovered (old) reservoirs through additional drilling in periods after discovery and (2) discovery of new fields with proved reserves or of new reservoirs of proved reserves in old fields.

The net quantity of proved reserves as of the balance sheet date. Proved oil reserves are the estimated quantities of crude oil and natural gas liquids which geological and engineering data demonstrate with reasonable certainty to be recoverable.
Purchase of minerals in place.
Production of proved reserves.

Quantity of oil or gas subject to purchase under long-term supply, purchase, and similar agreements or contracts with government and authority, if entity either participates in operation of property in which oil or gas is located or serves as producer of reserve.
Changes in proved reserve estimates resulting from application of improved recovery techniques.

Revisions represent changes in previous estimates of proved reserves, either upward or downward, resulting from new information (except for an increase in proved acreage) normally obtained from development drilling and production history or resulting from change in economic factors.
Sales of minerals in place.
The proportional interest of net proved oil reserve quantities of equity investees.
Minimum amount of net capital required to be maintained by broker-dealer parent, calculated under Aggregate Indebtedness Standard.
Minimum amount of net capital required to be maintained by broker-dealer subsidiary to engage in security transaction, calculated under Aggregate Indebtedness Standard.
Minimum amount of net capital required to be maintained by broker-dealer and its subsidiary, calculated under Aggregate Indebtedness Standard.
Amount of net capital required to be maintained by futures commission merchant (FCM) per Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC) requirement.
B-737-700 aircraft type.
Named other party that participates in a financial transaction. Examples include, but not limited to, the name of the financial institution.
Information by type of judicial proceeding, alternative dispute resolution or claim.
Average of a range of values, calculated with consideration of proportional relevance.
Energy measure of oil and natural gas production reserves.

Energy measure of interests in proved developed reserves of crude oil, including condensate and natural gas liquids, natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, or other nonrenewable natural resource that is intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas.

Energy measure of proved undeveloped reserves of crude oil, including condensate and natural gas liquids, natural gas, synthetic oil and gas, or other nonrenewable natural resource that is intended to be upgraded into synthetic oil and gas.

Energy measure of proved reserve of oil and gas, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of increase (decrease) in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas related to revision of a previous estimate resulting from new information, except for an increase in proved acreage, or change in economic factors, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of increase in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas resulting from application of improved recovery techniques, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of increase in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas resulting from purchase of mineral in place, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of increase in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas resulting from the extension of the proved acreage of previously discovered reservoir or discovery of new field with proved reserve or of new reservoir of proved reserve in old field, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of decrease in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas resulting from production, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of increase (decrease) of quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).

Energy measure of decrease in quantity of proved reserve of oil and gas resulting from sale of mineral in place, stated in a unit of energy. For example, but not limited to, barrel of oil equivalents (BOE) or one thousand cubic feet of natural gas equivalent (Mcfe).
Expiration date for purchase of share under share repurchase plan, in YYYY-MM-DD format. Includes, but is not limited to, repurchase of stock and unit of ownership.

Amount, before effect of reinsurance, of life insurance issued and outstanding, as disclosed in supplementary reinsurance information. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and adjustment to face value.
Amount of life insurance issued and outstanding ceded to other entity, as disclosed in supplementary reinsurance information. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and adjustment to face value.

Amount of life insurance issued and outstanding assumed from other entity, as disclosed in supplementary reinsurance information. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and adjustment to face value.

Amount, after effect of reinsurance, of life insurance issued and outstanding, as disclosed in supplementary reinsurance information. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and adjustment to face value.

Percentage of assumed life insurance contract issued and outstanding to life insurance contract issued and outstanding after effect of reinsurance, as disclosed in supplementary reinsurance information. Includes, but is not limited to, dividend and adjustment to face value.
A roll forward is a reconciliation of a concept from the beginning of a period to the end of a period.
Amount of estimated future accumulated cash inflow from the sale of proved oil and gas reserves.
Amount of estimated future accumulated cash outflow for costs to be incurred in developing proved oil and gas reserves.
Amount of estimated future accumulated cash outflow for costs to be incurred in producing proved oil and gas reserves.
Amount of estimated future accumulated cash outflow for income tax, based on the future income less future expense derived from production and sale of proved oil and gas reserves.
Amount, after future accumulated cash outflow for development and production costs and future income tax, of estimated future accumulated cash inflow from the sale of proved oil and gas reserves.

Amount of discount on future accumulated cash inflow, after deducting future accumulated cash outflow for development and production costs and future income tax, from sale of proved oil and gas reserves, using a discount rate of 10 percent a year.
Disclosure of information about condensed income statement including, but not limited to, income statements of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.

Disclosure of information about condensed statement of comprehensive income (loss) including, but not limited to, statements of comprehensive income (loss) of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Tabular disclosure of condensed statement of comprehensive income (loss) including, but not limited to, statements of comprehensive income (loss) of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
Amount authorized for purchase of share under share repurchase plan. Includes, but is not limited to, repurchase of stock and unit of ownership.
Volume increase (decrease) of proved reserves of oil and gas.
Amount of increase in standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow as a result of previously estimated development costs incurred.
Residential building containing multiple separate housing units.
Individual, freestanding, unattached residential building.
Amount of accretion of discount for the standardized measure of discounted future net cash flow related to proved oil and gas reserves.
Information by consolidated entity or group of entities.
Entity or group of entities consolidated into reporting entity.
Information by name of entity in which ownership interest is disclosed. Excludes equity method investee and named security investment.
Name of entity in which ownership interest is disclosed. Excludes equity method investee and named security investment.
Product or service, or a group of similar products or similar services.
Information by product and service, or group of similar products and similar services.
Disclosure of information about common dimension, domain and member.

Information by adjustment to previously issued financial statements. Includes, but is not limited to, adjustment for retrospective application of amendment to accounting standards, other change in accounting principle, correction of error, and other revision.

Adjustment to previously issued financial statements. Includes, but is not limited to, adjustment for retrospective application of amendment to accounting standards, other change in accounting principle, correction of error, and other revision.

Indicates location of property related to investment in mortgage loan on real estate by entity with substantial portion of business acquiring and holding investment real estate or interest in real estate.
Volume of reserve quantity of oil and gas attributable to consolidated subsidiary with noncontrolling interest.
Indicates (true false) whether reserve quantity of oil and gas is attributable to consolidated subsidiary with noncontrolling interest.
Indicates (true false) whether proved reserve of oil and gas is located entirely within home country.
Middle value in data set.
Average of range of values, calculated as sum of numbers in set divided by count of numbers in set.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Cumulative-effect adjustment to financial statements in period of adoption of amendment to accounting standards.
Increase (decrease) to financial statements for cumulative-effect adjustment in period of adoption of amendment to accounting standards.
Represents amount after cumulative-effect adjustment to financial statements in period of adoption of amendment to accounting standards.
Cumulative increase (decrease) to previously issued financial statements for correction of error.

Cumulative increase (decrease) to previously issued financial statements for retrospective application of amendment to accounting standards and adjustment for reclassification from amendment to accounting standards.
Cumulative increase (decrease) to previously issued financial statements for change in accounting principle. Excludes adjustment for amendment to accounting standards.
Cumulative increase (decrease) to previously issued financial statements for reclassification. Excludes adjustment for reclassification from amendment to accounting standards.
Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
Eliminating entry for intercompany amount within obligor group and investment in nonobligor subsidiary.

Eliminating entry for intercompany amount between obligor group of consolidated entity, consisting of parent company, subsidiary issuer, and guarantor subsidiary on combined basis, and nonobligor subsidiary. Excludes elimination of investment in nonobligor subsidiary.
Indicates (true false) whether asset, liability, and result of operation of combined guarantor and issuer of security are not materially different than amount in consolidated financial statements.
Indicates (true false) whether combined guarantor and issuer have no material asset, liability, or result of operation.
Indicates (true false) whether issuer is finance subsidiary and parent has fully and unconditionally guaranteed security and no other subsidiary of parent guaranteed security.
Indicates (true false) whether issuer is finance subsidiary that coissued security jointly and severally with parent and no other subsidiary of parent guarantees security.
Indicates (true false) whether summarized financial information is preacquisition for acquired entity that is guarantor or issuer of guaranteed security registered or being registered.
The entire disclosure for affiliate whose security is pledged as collateral for security registered or being registered.

Eliminating entry for intercompany amount between affiliate group whose security is pledged as collateral for security registered or being registered and affiliate not part of that affiliate group.

Indicates (true false) whether asset, liability, and result of operation of affiliate group, whose security is pledged as collateral for security registered or being registered, are not materially different than amount in consolidated financial statements.
Indicates (true false) whether affiliate group, whose security is pledged as collateral for security registered or being registered, has no material asset, liability, or result of operation.

Indicates (true false) whether summarized financial information is preacquisition for acquired entity that is affiliate whose security is pledged as collateral for security registered or being registered.
